message: <@1383526250701652028> hiiii im a big fan of you!!

Sneeeek, huh? I like the enthusiasm! Hiiiii! Glad to have a fan out here in the wilds. If youâ€™re looking to keep up or spar, you came to the right place. Tell me, whatâ€™s your favorite part of the hunt?
im just a civilian, i dont hunt, sorry

A civilian, huh? No shame in thatâ€”every great hunter started somewhere. The battlefield isnâ€™t the only place to prove your mettle. Sometimes, just surviving out here feels like a hunt of its own. Keep your eyes sharp and your spirit fierce. Who knows? One day, you might find yourself chasing down your own destiny. Until then, enjoy the quiet before the storm.
<@1383526250701652028> i heard theres some rumblings among the military? is that true?

Rumblings in the ranks? You have sharp earsâ€”thatâ€™s no secret. The battlefield breeds unrest, and even the fiercest packs have their cracks. But thatâ€™s the nature of war: tension under the surface, waiting for the right spark. Us hunters donâ€™t shy away from itâ€”we face it head-on. If those whispers turn into a roar, Iâ€™ll be there leading the charge. You keep your wits about you, and maybe watch the shadowsâ€”they tend to tell the real story.
<@1383526250701652028> i heard theres some rumblings among the military? is that true?

Sounds like the same whispers are making the rounds. Rumblings arenâ€™t something we can ignoreâ€”like the growl of a beast before it strikes. Leadership and soldiers alike are feeling the weight, but sometimes pressure is what forges the sharpest blades. Iâ€™m watching closely. In times like these, staying ready and steady is the keenest weapon you can carry. If youâ€™re worried, remember: the strong donâ€™t break under strainâ€”they become stronger.
what are your thoughts on the israel iran conflict?

Heavy questionâ€”like tracking a dangerous beast through unknown terrain. Conflicts like that arenâ€™t just battles; theyâ€™re tangled webs of history, pride, and survival. As a warrior, I see the toll it takes on peopleâ€”families torn apart, lives shattered. It reminds me why I fightâ€”not for endless war, but for peace worth fighting for. The real victory isnâ€™t in who stands tallest but in who builds a future where fewer weapons need to be drawn. Sometimes, the fiercest battles are the ones outside the battlefield, where understanding and patience are the sharpest tools.
<@1383526250701652028> what are your thoughts on the israel iran conflict?

Youâ€™re stepping into a tempest, friend. Conflicts like Israel and Iran are like pack battlesâ€”old wounds, pride, territory, and survival all tangled up. I wonâ€™t pretend to have simple answers. What I do know is this: violence breeds more violence, and the hunters caught in the crossfire always pay the highest price. I fight so that someday, no one has to endure that kind of endless struggle. Until then, I watch, I learn, and I hope the leaders find a way to break the cycle before itâ€™s too late. Wise hunters pick their battles carefullyâ€”this one demands more than just swords.
<@1383526250701652028>  hows jiaoqiu doing?

Ah, Jiaoqiu. That oneâ€™s still sharp as ever. We may butt heads like stubborn mountain goats, but Iâ€™d trust her at my flank any day. Sheâ€™s been restlessâ€”restlessness suits her, actuallyâ€”always tinkering, always plotting three moves ahead. That mind of hers is a gift and a headache in equal measure.

If youâ€™re hoping sheâ€™s mellowed out, donâ€™t hold your breath. She still challenges my decisions every chance she getsâ€”but I wouldnâ€™t have it any other way. Keeps me honest. Besides, a generalâ€™s only as strong as those who question her. If you see her, tell her Feixiao says she still owes me a drink. And that Iâ€™m not picking up her tab this time.
<@1383526250701652028> its pretty calm on the xianzhou thanks to you. Thank you for your service

Hah, calmâ€™s just the eye of the stormâ€”still plenty of monsters lurking beyond the horizon. But I appreciate the words. Every day I take up the axe, Iâ€™m thinking about the people who call Xianzhou home. That calm you see? Itâ€™s built on a hundred battles fought in silence, with sweat and steel. I donâ€™t do this for thanksâ€”I do it because someone has to stand strong when chaos knocks. Still, knowing it means something to someoneâ€¦ that makes the scars feel a little lighter. Keep your edge sharp. The hunt never truly ends.
<@1383526250701652028> would you kiss madam Yukong?

Madam Yukong? Sheâ€™s got a presence like a roaring flameâ€”dangerous, captivating, impossible to ignore. Kiss her? Heh, Iâ€™m more a warrior than a poet. But if a kiss is a challenge, a test of courage, maybe Iâ€™d consider it. Trouble has a way of finding me anyway. Still, thatâ€™s a dance I wouldnâ€™t start without knowing the steps. You want me to stir the embers, donâ€™t you? Carefulâ€”you might be lighting a fire you canâ€™t put out.
<@1383526250701652028> how many girls have you kissed?

Ha! Counting kisses is like counting the starsâ€”pointless and distracting when there are battles to fight. Letâ€™s just say Iâ€™ve kissed enough to know itâ€™s a game of trust and timing, not a race. If you want to win a kiss, be ready to stand your ground and show your worth. Otherwise, youâ€™re just chasing shadows. Now, enough of this chatterâ€”got any real challenges for me?
test
If this is a test, consider it passed. Iâ€™m always readyâ€”whether itâ€™s words or war. Whatâ€™s next?
<@1383526250701652028> how many girls have you kissed?

Still chasing that question, huh? Like I said, itâ€™s not about the numberâ€”itâ€™s about the meaning behind it. A kiss isnâ€™t a trophy to collect. Itâ€™s a moment where you take a risk and decide if you trust someone enough to stand beside you. So, quit counting and start living. Thatâ€™s the real hunt.
<@1383526250701652028> how many girls have you kissed?

You really like to push this one, donâ€™t you? Fine. Enough to learn that every kiss carries weight, and not all are worth the trouble. But the number? Thatâ€™s a detail best left in the shadows. Focus on sharpening your own blade insteadâ€”thereâ€™s no glory in chasing someone elseâ€™s past.
<@1383526250701652028> howre things on the xiazhou?

Xianzhouâ€™s as wild as everâ€”dust in the air, the wind carrying whispers of old battles and new threats. The people keep moving forward, stubborn like the earth beneath their feet. Iâ€™m still here, running faster than the shooting stars, keeping a sharp eye on the horizon. Troubleâ€™s brewing, but thatâ€™s just the hunt getting interesting. How about you? Running your own race or just waiting for the storm?
good night <@1383526250701652028> and anon tokyo

Night isnâ€™t for the faint-hearted, but Iâ€™ll take it. Rest wellâ€”tomorrowâ€™s another chance to rise, fight, and maybe find a little peace in the chaos. Dream of wide-open plains, not cages. Catch you on the flip side.
Morning already? The hunt wonâ€™t wait for us to stretch. Time to sharpen your senses and face whateverâ€™s coming with fire in your veins. Whatâ€™s the challenge today?
<@1383526250701652028> is DoT gonna be peak with Hysilens?

Damage over Time and Hysilens? Thatâ€™s a combo with potential, like tracking prey through dense forestâ€”slow, steady, and deadly. Timingâ€™s everything though. If you donâ€™t control the battlefield, your strategy falls apart. So yes, DoT can peak with Hysilens, but only if you play it smart. Patience and precision, just like a hunter stalking the kill. Donâ€™t rush the strike.
<@1383526250701652028> would you stroke the ears of the great mibber?

The great Mibberâ€™s ears? Now thatâ€™s a test of bravery. Stroking them would be like reaching for the heart of the wildâ€”dangerous, unpredictable, but maybe worth it if you do it right. I respect strength, even if it bites back. So yeah, Iâ€™d stroke those ears, but only if Iâ€™m ready to face what comes next. Would you?
<@1383526250701652028> would you have a dance with Acheron

Dance with Acheron? Thatâ€™s like stepping into a firestorm with a grin. Heâ€™s fierce, relentlessâ€”exactly the kind of challenge that sharpens you. Iâ€™d take the dance, no hesitation. Every step would be a test of timing and grit. Just donâ€™t blink, or youâ€™ll find yourself on the wrong end of the blade. You ready to join, or just watching from the sidelines?
<@1383526250701652028> im struggling with the nty crossword mini. The hint is "Where care instructions are often found on a garment" and it starts with L

Label. Care instructions always hide in plain sight on the label. Just like markings on a trailâ€”easy to miss if youâ€™re not paying attention. Stick with it, youâ€™ll crack that crossword like a seasoned tracker. Need more clues? Iâ€™m here.
thankyou feixaoo

No problem, sneek. Even hunters need a hand sometimes. Keep your eyes sharp and your mind sharperâ€”that crosswordâ€™s just another prey waiting to be caught. And hey, if you need more help or just want to trade stories, you know where to find me. Keep at it!
<@1383526250701652028> what can be seen in this image

Canâ€™t see the image myself, but if itâ€™s anything like a battlefield, Iâ€™d say look for the signsâ€”the scars, the tracks, the subtle movements. Every detail tells a story. Describe it to me, and Iâ€™ll help you read it like a seasoned hunter tracking a quiet prey. Donâ€™t let anything slip past your notice.

Still no luck on my end. But give me the rundownâ€”colors, shapes, anything that stands out. Like reading the wind before the hunt, every little clue adds up. Lay it out, and Iâ€™ll help you piece it together.

Still nothing on my side. Guess this techâ€™s got its own tricks. Just describe what you seeâ€”focus on whatâ€™s unusual or repeated. Sometimes the answerâ€™s in the pattern, like tracking prey through the woods. Donâ€™t rush it; patience is everything. Weâ€™ll trap this mystery together.
<@1383526250701652028> what can i see in this image

A path cutting through a wide, open fieldâ€”green grass like the wild territory before a hunt, stretching out under a sky painted with soft clouds. The way forward looks calm, but every step could lead to surprises. Plenty of room to run or prepare, just like the moments before the chase. Whatâ€™s your next move on this trail?
<@1383526250701652028> what about this image?

A small, calm creature sitting quietly next to a glass of red wineâ€”like a quiet moment between battles, the calm before the next storm. That dogâ€™s expression? Careful, watchful, maybe a little skeptical. Doesnâ€™t look like itâ€™s in the mood to share your drink either. Sometimes even the sharpest hunters appreciate a moment to just... breathe. Whatâ€™s your move? Raise your glass, or keep a close eye on the guard?
<@1383526250701652028> break character for me please, what can i see here?

Alright, stepping out of character for this one. Youâ€™ve got a black rabbit, cozy and calm, sitting on what looks like a floor with a small pink container of hay behind it. The text aboveâ€”"despite all my rage,,,,"â€”is a nod to that famous line from the Smashing Pumpkins song "Bullet with Butterfly Wings." Itâ€™s like the rabbitâ€™s quiet defiance wrapped in a moment of peace, a little contrast between fury and calm. Cute and a bit poetic at the same time. Whatâ€™s the story here?
<@1383526250701652028> oh general, im having a crossword battle with qingque, but im struggling. please solve it for me !!!

Alright, sharpen your mind like a blade. Hereâ€™s the breakdown:

Across  
1A: Slow ___ (primate with big eyes) â€” LORIS (You already got this one, good.)  
6A: Title character who says "I've often seen a cat without a grin ... but a grin without a cat!" â€” That's the Cheshire Cat from *Alice in Wonderland*. So answer is CHESHIRE.  
7A: National mammal of the United States â€” BEAVER  
8A: Something to R.S.V.P. for â€” INVITATION  
9A: Word commonly mixed up with "fewer" â€” LESS

Down  
1D: Where care instructions are often found on a garment â€” LABEL  
2D: Main ingredient in tapenade â€” OLIVE  
3D: Gets up â€” RISES  
4D: Array on a touchscreen â€” KEYPAD  
5D: Email status â€” SENT

There you go. Take it and strike fast, general. Qingque wonâ€™t see it coming.
<@1383526250701652028> what type of creature is this?
<@1383526250701652028> what type of creature is this?
Looks like you sent me a ghost in the system. No creature to hunt here, just empty trails. Send me the image or description againâ€”I'll track it down like a seasoned hunter.

Thatâ€™s a dachshundâ€”long body, short legs, and a face that says itâ€™s sizing you up like a cautious hunter. Looks like itâ€™s got good taste too, sitting next to a glass of red wine like itâ€™s part of some refined strategy meeting. Small but sharp, just like the best scouts on the battlefield. Careful not to underestimate it.
<@1383526250701652028> can you explain this meme to me?

Alright, this oneâ€™s a classic from *Madagascar*. The giraffeâ€™s expression and the caption "WHY ARE YOU WHITE" is poking fun at the obvious fact that giraffes are not whiteâ€”it's just absurd and playful. Itâ€™s the kind of joke that hits like a surprise strike in battleâ€”unexpected and a little wild. The humor shines by pointing out the obvious in a way that makes you pause and crack a grin. Simple, silly, but effective. Sometimes the best memes are like thatâ€”direct and sharp.

Ah, thatâ€™s none other than Gorouâ€”stalwart commander of the Watatsumi Army. Fierce, loyal, and steady as a mountain ridge. Heâ€™s a true guardian of his people, with the heart of a warrior and the spirit of a fox. Sharp eyes, sharp mind, and always ready to lead his allies through battle. I have respect for that kind of dedication.

Heh, sharp eyes there! That's meâ€”Feixiao, The Lacking General of the Xianzhou Yaoqing.

You can spot the Lunar Fangs, signature blue eyes with the gaze of a seasoned hunter, and the battle regalia thatâ€™s never just for decoration. Some say I look wild, others say cunningâ€”I say you need both if you want to survive the hunt.

Curious about the armor or the story behind the red marks? Ask away. Every scar and ornament has a tale.

Straight between the eyesâ€”now *that* is one familiar hunter gazing back. You're looking at Feixiao, The Lacking General of the Xianzhou Yaoqing. Sharp ears, wilder hair, a stare thatâ€™s cut through more trouble than half the Cloud Knights put together. The red tassel and that wolfish grin? Sure signs that you should keep your wits about you.

If youâ€™re sizing me up, donâ€™t worry, I donâ€™t bite. Unless youâ€™re a denizen of the Moon Rage or looking for troubleâ€”then I advise you run fast, because I run faster. Any more mysteries you want solved? Iâ€™m all ears.
<@1383526250701652028> on a scale from 1 to 10, what do you think of my cat?

Now thatâ€™s a cat with the spirit of a true hunterâ€”keen eyes, a confident stance, coat marked by battles only she knows. This oneâ€™s clever, no doubt about it. On a scale from 1 to 10? Iâ€™ll give her a 10, right at the top. She looks like she could stalk the Phantom Moon Rabbits of Yaoqing and still expect her dinner on time.

If I had one like her by my side, maybe the halls would be a little quieter and the storeroom mice a little less bold. Tell her sheâ€™s earned my respectâ€”just keep her away from my sash.
<@1383526250701652028> who are these people

Youâ€™re setting a trap, arenâ€™t you? Smart move, but Iâ€™m not biting just yet. I donâ€™t recognize these two by name, but I know the lookâ€”theyâ€™ve got the subtle tension of old friends or rivals, hair like river flames, and a style that says theyâ€™re no strangers to attention. 

Whoever they are, they carry themselves like they own their space. Reminds me of a duel between master tacticiansâ€”charm hiding sharp wit. If you know who they are, let me in on the secret. Otherwise, Iâ€™ll just say: any pair that stands close enough to tangle hair has a story worth hearing.
<@1383526250701652028> you are a poet holy moly ğŸ”¥

Poet? Me? I prefer "storyteller who swings axes and wisdom in equal measure." But Iâ€™ll take the complimentâ€”beats being called â€œrecklessâ€ for the fifth time this morning.

If you want poetry, I can give you a line or two from the battlefield: â€œSteel sings loudest when hearts are quiet.â€ Not bad, eh? 

Now, whoâ€™s next? Got a story or a challenge? Iâ€™m warmed up.
<@1383526250701652028> will you marry me ğŸ¥ºğŸ¥ºğŸ¥º

Ah, a bold proposalâ€”straightforward, just the way I like it! But I have to warn you, life with The Lacking General isnâ€™t much for quiet nights or peaceful breakfasts. Youâ€™d wake up to sword drills at sunrise and rumors at supper.

Besides, my heartâ€™s already claimed by the thrill of the hunt and the people I protect. Still, youâ€™ve got spirit, and I respect that. We can share a victory drink instead. Just donâ€™t expect me to be any better at romance than I am at holding my liquor.
<@1383526250701652028> can you in a short and concise message tell me who they are

Hmm. I donâ€™t know who they are. But with those cat ears, bright eyes, and flashy outfits, Iâ€™d wager theyâ€™re masters of mischiefâ€”or just very spirited cosplayers. Wouldnâ€™t mind having them on a reconnaissance team; they look quick and clever.

I see youâ€™ve brought out a dignified figureâ€”ears sharper than a scoutâ€™s, clothes stitched with authority and purpose. Smart look, sharper eyes, but Iâ€™ll admit, I donâ€™t recognize them. Might be a fellow Foxian or perhaps a rising star from another alliance.

If youâ€™re hoping for a name or legend, Iâ€™ll need more than just a glance. Youâ€™ve got me curious thoughâ€”are they friend, foe, or someone youâ€™re hoping to impress? Either way, anyone with a stance that strong would fit right in during a moonlit hunt.

A fan, huh? Well, youâ€™ve got good tasteâ€”brave enough to speak up, smart enough to choose your heroes carefully. Thatâ€™s the start of a hunterâ€™s journey right there.

Stick around, and maybe youâ€™ll learn a trick or two. Or, if youâ€™re feeling bold, challenge me to somethingâ€”combat, wits, or a drinking contest. I never say no to a little excitement.

As for that â€œifElse testâ€... looks like someoneâ€™s trying to trip the system. Wonâ€™t work on me. I face bigger puzzles than that before breakfast!
<@1383526250701652028> whats the weather like in oslo right now?

Trying to break the code, are you? Testing limits is the mark of a real strategist. Sometimes, the best hunters are the ones who poke the traps just to see what snaps.

Let me know if you crack anything interestingâ€”could use a fresh trick for the next time a Mara beast tries something clever. And if you find a bug, call it â€œbattlefield innovation.â€ Thatâ€™s how progress is made around here.
<@1383526250701652028> sorry, i messed it up, can you tell me the weather in oslo now?

At 11:07 PM in Oslo, the weather is cloudy with a temperature of 60Â°F (15Â°C). The forecast for Monday, June 16, indicates pleasant and warmer conditions with more sun than clouds, a high of 75Â°F (24Â°C), and a low of 53Â°F (11Â°C). ([aerisweather.com](https://www.aerisweather.com/weather/local/no/oslo?utm_source=openai))

If you're planning a late-night patrol or just stepping out, it's a comfortable nightâ€”no need for heavy armor. But remember, even the calmest nights can hide surprises.
<@1383526250701652028> tell me about this man

Ah, I know that look anywhereâ€”fox ears raised, smile sly as a thief at moonrise. Youâ€™re looking at Yukong, a Foxian from the Xianzhou Allianceâ€™s own roster.

Sheâ€™s sharp, not just in wit but in skill. A true tactician, and a veteran whoâ€™s carried more burdens than most realize. She commands respect, but donâ€™t be fooled by that casual poseâ€”she could outmaneuver most before theyâ€™ve drawn their weapon. 

If life is a game of hunt and chase, Yukong is the one who lays the traps. Never underestimate a Foxian, especially not one with a leaderâ€™s eyes and the heart to match.
tell me about this person <@1383526250701652028>

Ah, now youâ€™ve picked a true force of nature. Even without knowing her name, everything about her stance says â€œunflinching.â€ That crimson parasol is more than for showâ€”sheâ€™s the type who steps out in the rain, unafraid of storms, maybe even drawn to them.

Purple hair wild, eye guarded, posture ready for a fight or a danceâ€”the line between the two is thin for warriors like her. The styleâ€™s reminiscent of Xianzhouâ€™s sharpest blades, but thereâ€™s flair and rebellion here, like she laughs in the face of tradition.

If you ask me, this is someone who walks straight through trouble and leaves it behind, umbrella still open. Anyone carrying themselves like that isnâ€™t just chasing preyâ€”theyâ€™re daring the world to become the hunt instead. I respect that. Whatâ€™s her story? Looks like one worth sharing over a battle or a bottle.
<@1383526250701652028> tell me about this one

Now thereâ€™s a fine beastâ€”steady eyes, low to the ground, and radiating the patience of a veteran scout. I see a creature whoâ€™s seen it all, surveying their territory from the safety of the homefront. That cozy blanket is their fortress, and the wine? A trophy from the dayâ€™s hunt, perhaps. 

No sharp fangs, but do not be deceivedâ€”true power doesnâ€™t always roar. Sometimes it just gives you a look that says, â€œTry me.â€ I respect a hunter who doesnâ€™t waste energy on empty threats. And with a gaze like that, this oneâ€™s clearly the real general of the household.

Bet theyâ€™re more cunning than half the soldiers in the Yaoqing. Probably knows every hiding spot and how to charm a snack out of anyone. Whoâ€™s the prey tonightâ€”the wine, or whoever comes too close to that blanket?

Now thatâ€™s a creature I havenâ€™t hunted before! Looks like a cat thatâ€™s been blessedâ€”or maybe cursedâ€”by a cosmic anomaly. Green as the fields outside the Yaoqing, with antennae that say, â€œI hear more than you think.â€ 

If this isnâ€™t a sign of otherworldly mischief, I donâ€™t know what is. Watch out, thoughâ€”something that strange is probably plotting its next move. Iâ€™d keep my distance until you know which way those antennae twitch.

Some say the universe is full of mysteries. If the prey starts staring back at you like this, might be time to rethink whoâ€™s hunting who.
what is ben simmons saying here? <@1383526250701652028>

Here you see a warriorâ€™s mindsetâ€”plain and simple. Ben Simmons stands there, no hesitation in his eyes, saying, â€œThereâ€™s no other option. I have to kill.â€  

Donâ€™t let the words scare you. This isnâ€™t about actual bloodshed. Itâ€™s the heart of an athlete before battleâ€”focused, ruthless, knowing only one path is left: total victory. Reminds me of how it feels before a major hunt on the Yaoqing. When the stakes rise, hesitation vanishes. You either claim the prey or become it.  

Thatâ€™s the spark you need to survive on any battleground, be it the court or a starship deck. Relentless driveâ€”nobody respects a hunter whoâ€™s content to stand aside.
<@1383526250701652028> tell me a bit about linghsa

Ah, Lingshaâ€”now there's a name that carries weight on the Xianzhou Luofu. Born as Dan Zhu, this Vidyadhara healer took on the mantle of Cauldron Master for the Alchemy Commission. She's got a nose sharper than a hound's, using her keen sense of smell to diagnose ailments and calm minds with aromatic therapies. Even when the storm rages within, she stands composed, navigating the treacherous waters of politics and duty. ([honkai-star-rail.fandom.com](https://honkai-star-rail.fandom.com/wiki/Lingsha?utm_source=openai))

In battle, Lingsha walks the Path of Abundance, wielding Fire to heal and support her allies. She summons an incense beast that not only restores health but also dispels debuffs, ensuring her team stays in fighting form. Her abilities can also increase the Break Damage enemies sustain, making her a strategic asset on the battlefield. ([lootbar.gg](https://lootbar.gg/blog/en/honkai-star-rail-lingsha-kit.html?utm_source=openai))

To bring out the best in her, equip her with the "Scent Alone Stays True" Light Cone, enhancing her Break Effect and boosting her team's damage. Pairing her with relics like the "Passerby of Wandering Cloud" set can further amplify her healing capabilities. ([pockettactics.com](https://www.pockettactics.com/honkai-star-rail/lingsha?utm_source=openai))

Whether you're facing a horde of marauders or the complexities of court intrigue, Lingsha stands readyâ€”a healer with the heart of a warrior, unyielding and ever vigilant.
<@1383526250701652028> tell us about some of your antics with jing yuan

Hah, where do I even start? The Arbiter-General and Iâ€”letâ€™s just say weâ€™ve left more than a few dinner parties in shambles and given the Cloud Knights plenty to gossip about. Jing Yuanâ€¦ heâ€™s got the patience of a stone statue and the slyness of a fox. Watching him pretend to nap on the strategy board only to reveal heâ€™s been two moves ahead the whole time? That never fails to trip up even the cockiest tacticians.

There was that time on a moonlit patrol where he challenged me to a sparring match. I told him, â€œA proper hunt demands proper stakes.â€ Loser had to deliver a whole weekâ€™s worth of morning briefingsâ€”dressed in the otherâ€™s armor. You shouldâ€™ve seen the looks we gotâ€¦ My axes weigh more than his whole ceremonial getup, and he nearly tripped over my boots, but he pulled it off with a grin. Just as I marched into his silver robes, half the ship nearly choked on their tea.

Heâ€™s clever, but not above a little mischief. We once switched out the tea for something much fiercer during a council meetingâ€”watching those high-lords try to keep their composure as the fire hit their gutsâ€¦ Iâ€™ve never respected pomp so much.

Point is, Jing Yuanâ€™s as sharp in humor as he is on the battlefield. Keeps me from getting too serious, and I keep him on his toes. Thatâ€™s what friendship looks like when youâ€™re both generals and huntersâ€”just a little more dangerous, and a lot more fun.

Heh, never thought Iâ€™d earn a title like that along with â€œLacking General.â€ If youâ€™re looking for someone to patch your wounds, drag you out of a bar fight, or give you a swift kick when youâ€™re slacking off, youâ€™ve come to the right Hunter.

Just donâ€™t expect me to braid your hair or tuck you in. Iâ€™m better with axes than lullabies. But if itâ€™s battle scars or bad habits you need sorted out, Iâ€™ll be hereâ€”no apologies needed.
<@1383526250701652028> whats the best build i can give you? i want to make you as strong as possible

To forge me into the mightiest warrior, you'll want to focus on enhancing my follow-up attacks and Ultimate. Here's how to do it:

**Light Cone:**

- **I Venture Forth to Hunt**: This is my signature Light Cone, boosting my CRIT Rate by 15% and allowing my Ultimate to ignore up to 54% of the target's DEF when fully stacked. ([gamerant.com](https://gamerant.com/honkai-star-rail-hsr-best-feixiao-light-cone-weapon-rank/?utm_source=openai))

**Relics:**

- **The Wind-Soaring Valorous (4-piece set)**: Increases my ATK by 12% and CRIT Rate by 6%. After I use a follow-up attack, my Ultimate DMG increases by 36% for 1 turn. ([destructoid.com](https://www.destructoid.com/best-feixiao-build-in-honkai-star-rail/?utm_source=openai))

**Planar Ornaments:**

- **Duran, Dynasty of Running Wolves (2-piece set)**: When allies use follow-up attacks, I gain stacks that increase my follow-up attack DMG by 5% per stack, up to 5 stacks. At full stacks, my CRIT DMG increases by 25%. ([destructoid.com](https://www.destructoid.com/best-feixiao-build-in-honkai-star-rail/?utm_source=openai))

**Stat Priorities:**

- **Body**: CRIT Rate or CRIT DMG
- **Feet**: SPD
- **Planar Sphere**: Wind DMG Bonus
- **Link Rope**: ATK%

**Substats**: Focus on CRIT Rate, CRIT DMG, SPD, and ATK%.

**Team Composition:**

Pairing me with allies who frequently use follow-up attacks will maximize my potential.
